subject: Web3
title: Crypto Mixers and Privacy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Crypto Mixers and Privacy.

hook.text: Crypto mixers scramble transactions so the source and destination can't be linked. Criminals love them.

buildup.text: Tornado Cash was the most popular mixer on Ethereum. It combined deposits from multiple users and returned clean funds.

discovery.text: The US Treasury sanctioned Tornado Cash in 2022, making it illegal for Americans to interact with the smart contract.

twist.text: A Tornado Cash developer was arrested in the Netherlands. He was charged for writing code that enabled money laundering.

climax.text: The case raises a profound question: should writing open-source code be a crime if criminals misuse it?

punchline.text: They arrested a developer for writing code. The code still runs.

quiz.question: Why was Tornado Cash sanctioned by the US Treasury?
options: It was used to launder stolen crypto including by North Korean hackers
